Package com.rapidminer.belt.reader

Interface MixedRow

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MixedRowReader
    public interface MixedRow
    A row of a Table that supports reading different formats. In contrast to NumericRow, CategoricalRow and ObjectRow, a MixedRow allows to read the entries as numbers, category indices or objects at the same time.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier
    See Also:
    MixedRowReader

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getIndex​(int index)
      Returns the category index value of the this row at the given index if the entry is part of a Column.Category.CATEGORICAL column.

      Returns the numeric value of the this row at the given index.

      Returns the object value of the this row at the given index.

      int position()
      Returns the position of the row in the table (0-based).
      int width()  

    • Method Detail

      • getNumeric

        double getNumeric​(int index)
        Returns the numeric value of the this row at the given index. Returns Double.NaN in case there is no numeric value at this index. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding).

        This method does not perform any range checks.

        Parameters:
        index - the index
        Returns:
        the value of the row at the given index if the value is Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE and Double.NaN otherwise

      • getIndex

        int getIndex​(int index)
        Returns the category index value of the this row at the given index if the entry is part of a Column.Category.CATEGORICAL column. Returns 0 in case of a Column.Category.OBJECT column and (int) getNumeric(index) in case of a Column.Category.NUMERIC column. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding).

        This method does not perform any range checks.

        Parameters:
        index - the index
        Returns:
        the category value index of the row at the given index for Column.Category.CATEGORICAL entries

      • getObject

        java.lang.Object getObject​(int index)
        Returns the object value of the this row at the given index. Returns null in case there is no object value at this index. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding).

        This method does not perform any range checks.

        Parameters:
        index - the index
        Returns:
        the value of the row at the given index if the value is Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE and null otherwise

      • getObject

        <T> T getObject​(int index,
                java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Returns the object value of the this row at the given index. Returns null in case there is no object value at this index. This method is well-defined for indices zero (including) to width() (excluding).

        This method does not perform any range checks.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected return type
        Parameters:
        index - the index
        type - the expected return type
        Returns:
        the value of the row at the given index if the value is Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE and null otherwise

      • width

        int width()
        Returns:
        the number of values in the row

      • position

        int position()
        Returns the position of the row in the table (0-based).
        Returns:
        the row position
